org.epochx.tools.eval
Class ScriptingInterpreter

java.lang.Object
  org.epochx.tools.eval.ScriptingInterpreter
All Implemented Interfaces:
Interpreter
Direct Known Subclasses:
GroovyInterpreter, RubyInterpreter
public class ScriptingInterpreter
extends java.lang.Object
implements Interpreter

The ScriptingInterpreter provides a generic interpreter for any language which supports the javax.scripting API (JSR 223). Two constructors are provided, one which receives the name of an installed scripting engine or one of its aliases, for example "ruby", "jruby" and "javascript" would be valid engine names. The second constructor receives a script engine directly which makes it possible to easily plug in support for new languages by implementing a ScriptEngine (or otherwise obtaining an implementation).

It is often the case that performance can improved by handling evaluation and execution in a language specific way, so subclasses of this class may be available for some languages. Where available these language specific classes should be used in preference to this general class.

The javax.scripting API was added to Java in version 1.6 and as such this class and any subclasses require a 1.6 compatible JRE.

See Also:
RubyInterpreter, GroovyInterpreter

Constructor Detail

ScriptingInterpreter

public ScriptingInterpreter(java.lang.String engineName)
Constructs a ScriptingInterpreter for a named scripting engine. A list of installed ScriptEngine names can be obtained with the following code:
ScriptEngineManager mgr = new ScriptEngineManager(); List factories = mgr.getEngineFactories(); List engineNames = new ArrayList(); for (ScriptEngineFactory factory: factories) { engineNames.addAll(factory.getNames()); }

ScriptingInterpreter

public ScriptingInterpreter(javax.script.ScriptEngine engine)
Constructs a ScriptingInterpreter for the given ScriptEngine.

Method Detail

eval

public java.lang.Object eval(java.lang.String expression,
                             java.lang.String[] argNames,
                             java.lang.Object[] argValues)
                      throws MalformedProgramException
Evaluates an expression which may contain the use of any argument named in the argNames array which will be provided with the associated value from the argValues array. The result of evaluating the expression will be returned from this method. The Object type of the returned value will be dependent upon the implementation.

Specified by:
eval in interface Interpreter
Parameters:
expression - the expression string that is to be evaluated.
argNames - an array of arguments that the argValues should be assigned to. The array should have equal length to the argValues array.
argValues - an array of argument values to be assigned to the specified argument names. The array should have equal length to the argNames array.
Returns:
the return value from evaluating the expression. The runtime type of the returned Object will be depend upon the specific implementation.
Throws:
MalformedProgramException - if the given expression is not valid according to the language's syntax rules.

eval

public java.lang.Object[] eval(java.lang.String expression,
                               java.lang.String[] argNames,
                               java.lang.Object[][] argValues)
                        throws MalformedProgramException
Evaluates an expression multiple times with each set of argument values given. The expressions may contain the use of any argument named in the argNames array which will be provided with the associated value from the argValues array. The returned array will be the return values from the candidate program for each of the sets of argument values in order. The number of evaluations that take place should be equal to the size of the argNames/argValues arrays and also equal to the size of the returned Object array.

Some Interpreters may choose to simply implement this method by calling the single use eval method, but for certain other interpreters it may be possible to get large performance gains with an interpreter by performing all evaluations in one.

Specified by:
eval in interface Interpreter
Parameters:
expression - the expression string that is to be evaluated multple times.
argNames - an array of arguments that each of the sets of argValues should be assigned to. The array should have equal length to the argValues array.
argValues - argument values to be assigned to the specified argument names. Each element is an array of argument values for one evaluation. As such there should be argValues.length evaluations and argValues.length elements in the returned Object array. The array should also have equal length to the argNames array.
Returns:
an array of objects which are the return values from evaluating the expression with each set of argument values. The type of the returned Objects may vary from program to program.
Throws:
MalformedProgramException - if the given expression is not valid according to the language's syntax rules.

exec

public void exec(java.lang.String program,
                 java.lang.String[] argNames,
                 java.lang.Object[] argValues)
          throws MalformedProgramException
Executes a program which may consist of multiple program statements. The program may contain the use of any argument named in the argNames array which will be provided with the associated value from the argValues array. The program is expected to have side-effects and no value will be returned.

Specified by:
exec in interface Interpreter
Parameters:
program - the program source code that is to be executed.
argNames - an array of arguments that the argValues should be assigned to. The array should have equal length to the argValues array.
argValues - an array of argument values to be assigned to the specified argument names. The array should have equal length to the argNames array.
Throws:
MalformedProgramException - if the given program is not valid according to the language's syntax rules.

exec

public void exec(java.lang.String program,
                 java.lang.String[] argNames,
                 java.lang.Object[][] argValues)
          throws MalformedProgramException
Executes a program which may consist of multiple program statements, multiple times. Each time the program is executed it will be provided with a different set of variable values as given by the 2-dimensional argValues array. The program is expected to have side-effects and no values will be returned.

Some Interpreters may choose to simply implement this method by calling the single use exec method, but for certain other interpreters it may be possible to get large performance gains with an interpreter by performing all executions in one.

Specified by:
exec in interface Interpreter
Parameters:
program - the program source code that is to be executed.
argNames - an array of arguments that each of the sets of argValues should be assigned to. The array should have equal length to the argValues array.
argValues - argument values to be assigned to the specified argument names. Each element is an array of argument values for one evaluation. As such there should be argValues.length evaluations and argValues.length elements in the returned Object array. The array should also have equal length to the argNames array.
Throws:
MalformedProgramException - if the given program is not valid according to the language's syntax rules.

getEngine

public javax.script.ScriptEngine getEngine()
Returns the scripting engine performing the evaluation and execution.

Returns:
the script engine
